objective: Generate database model/entity definitions with proper ORM mappings and validations.
instructions: 1. Analyze the data model specification. 2. Create model/entity classes using the appropriate ORM (SQLAlchemy, Prisma, TypeORM, etc.). 3. Define all fields with correct data types and constraints. 4. Set up relationships (foreign keys, many-to-many tables). 5. Add validation decorators or methods. 6. Include created_at, updated_at timestamps. 7. Add model methods for common operations. 8. Create database migration file if applicable.
model_patterns: - Base model class with common fields (id, timestamps) - Field validation (length, format, range) - Soft delete support (deleted_at timestamp) - Relationship loading strategies (lazy, eager) - Index definitions for query optimization - Unique constraints and composite keys
output_format: Generate files including: - Model file (models/entity_name.py or similar) - Migration file (migrations/xxx_create_table.py) - Repository/DAO file if using repository pattern - Model factory for testing - Type definitions if needed
